com.resourcemanager.controller

Class SkillController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.resourcemanager.controller.SkillController

  • @Controller
public class SkillController
extends java.lang.Object
    This controller responds to the user input and uses the service layer to create, read, update or delete the Skill data model objects. This controller receives the input, optionally validates it and then passes the input to the model and directs the user back to a view to display the model and accept further user input.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The skill service.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addSkill()
      Directs the user to the edit Skill view but with an id of 0 in order to create a new Skill only.
      java.lang.String editSkill(java.lang.Long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Passes the data model to the edit Skill view, and redirects the user to that view to respond to their input.
      java.lang.String listSkills(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Retrieves all Skills from the persistence layer and passes them to the Resources view to display them to the user and respond to their input.
      java.lang.String removeSkill(java.lang.Long id)
      Deletes a particular Skill from the application cache and persistence layer, updating the associated Allocations and Resources.
      java.lang.String saveSkill(Skill skill, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Takes the user input submitted via the edit Skill view and merges changes to the data model for the Skill and associated Allocations and Resources before passing that to the persistence layer.

                method=GET)
public java.lang.String listSkills(org.springframework.ui.Model model)

        @RequestMapping(value="/skills/save",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String saveSkill(@ModelAttribute(value="skill")
